# UIButton.Configuration

**Structure**

A configuration that specifies the appearance and behavior of a button and its contents.

## Declaration

```swift
struct Configuration
```

## Overview

You can configure and update a button with a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIButton/Configuration-swift.struct]. A button configuration contains all the customization options available with other methods, such as [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIButton/setTitle(_:for:)], and can serve as a replacement for those methods. Alternatively, you can use a configuration in combination with these other methods and adopt new button behaviors and appearance without rewriting your customized [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIButton] code.

## Creating configurations

- **plain()**: Creates a configuration for a button with a transparent background.
- **gray()**: Creates a configuration for a button with a gray background.
- **tinted()**: Creates a configuration for a button with a tinted background color.
- **filled()**: Creates a configuration for a button with a background filled with the button’s tint color.
- **borderless()**: Creates a configuration for a button that has a borderless style.
- **bordered()**: Creates a configuration for a button that has a bordered style.
- **borderedTinted()**: Creates a configuration for a button that has a tinted, bordered style.
- **borderedProminent()**: Creates a configuration for a button that has a prominent, bordered style.
- **glass()**: Creates a configuration for a button that has a Liquid Glass style.
- **prominentGlass()**: Creates a configuration for a button that has a prominent Liquid Glass style.
- **clearGlass()**: Creates a configuration for a button that has a clear Liquid Glass style.
- **prominentClearGlass()**: Creates a configuration for a button that has a prominent, clear Liquid Glass style.
- **updated(for:)**: Returns a copy of the configuration, updated for the given button.

## Configuring titles

- **title**: The text of the title label the button displays.
- **subtitle**: The text the subtitle label of the button displays.
- **attributedTitle**: The text and style attributes for the button’s title label.
- **attributedSubtitle**: The text and style attributes for the button’s subtitle label.
- **titleTextAttributesTransformer**: A structure to update the attributed title when the button state changes.
- **subtitleTextAttributesTransformer**: A structure to update the attributed subtitle when the button state changes.
- **UIConfigurationTextAttributesTransformer**: Defines a text transformation that can affect the visual appearance of a string.
- **titlePadding**: The distance between the title and subtitle labels.
- **titleAlignment**: The text alignment the button uses to lay out the title and subtitle.
- **UIButton.Configuration.TitleAlignment**: Specifies how to align a button’s title and subtitle.
- **titleLineBreakMode**: The line break mode the button uses to lay out the button’s title.
- **subtitleLineBreakMode**: The line break mode the button uses to lay out the button’s subtitle.

## Configuring images

- **image**: The foreground image the button displays.
- **imagePadding**: The distance between the button’s image and text.
- **imagePlacement**: The edge against which the button places the image.
- **imageReservation**: A value that reserves space for the image in the same axis as the edge against which the button places the image.
- **imageColorTransformer**: A block that transforms the image color when the button state changes.
- **preferredSymbolConfigurationForImage**: A requested configuration object for the button symbol image.

## Configuring layout

- **buttonSize**: A size that requests a preferred size for the button.
- **UIButton.Configuration.Size**: A predefined size for button elements.
- **contentInsets**: The distance from the button’s content area to its bounds.
- **setDefaultContentInsets()**: Restores the default content insets.

## Configuring button colors

- **baseBackgroundColor**: The untransformed color for background views.
- **baseForegroundColor**: The untransformed color for foreground views.

## Configuring the button background

- **background**: The configuration to customize the button background.
- **cornerStyle**: The button style that controls the display behavior of the background corner radius.
- **UIButton.Configuration.CornerStyle**: Settings that determine the appearance of the background corner radius.

## Configuring the indicator

- **indicator**: The style of the indicator that appears on the button.
- **UIButton.Configuration.Indicator**: Constants that determine the style of the indicator that appears on a button.
- **indicatorColorTransformer**: The color transformer for resolving the indicator color.

## Configuring the activity indicator

- **showsActivityIndicator**: A Boolean value that determines whether the button displays an activity indicator instead of an image.
- **activityIndicatorColorTransformer**: The color transformer for resolving the color of the activity indicator.

## Configuring selection behavior

- **automaticallyUpdateForSelection**: A Boolean value that determines whether the style automatically updates when the button is in a selected state.

## Configuring the appearance on macOS

- **macIdiomStyle**: The style to use when this button appears in macOS.
- **UIButton.Configuration.MacIdiomStyle**: The button style your app uses when running in macOS.

## Instance Properties

- **symbolContentTransition**

## Creating buttons from a configuration object

- **init(configuration:primaryAction:)**: Creates a new button with the specified configuration and registers the primary action event.

## Conforms To

- Copyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
